tags.name: simple-tooltip
tags.description:
`simple-tooltip`
`a simple tooltip forked from paper-tooltip with the same api minus apply removal`
  ### Styling
  The following custom properties and mixins are available for styling:

  Custom property | Description | Default
  ----------------|-------------|----------
  `--simple-tooltip-background` | The background color of the tooltip | `#616161`
  `--simple-tooltip-opacity` | The opacity of the tooltip | `0.9`
  `--simple-tooltip-text-color` | The text color of the tooltip | `white`
  `--simple-tooltip-delay-in` | Delay before tooltip starts to fade in | `500`
  `--simple-tooltip-delay-out` | Delay before tooltip starts to fade out | `0`
  `--simple-tooltip-duration-in` | Timing for animation when showing tooltip | `500`
  `--simple-tooltip-duration-out` | Timing for animation when hiding tooltip | `0`
  `--simple-tooltip-padding` | padding on the wrapper for the tip | `8px`
  `--simple-tooltip-margin` | margin on the wrapper for the tip | `0px`

Attributes:

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `animation-delay` {`number`} - The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

  * `_showing` {`boolean`} - 

  * `manual-mode` {`boolean`} - Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `fit-to-visible-bounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `margin-top` {`number`} - This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

  * `animation-entry` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on entry.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animation-exit` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on exit.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

Properties:

  * `for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

  * `animationDelay` {`number`} - The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

  * `_showing` {`boolean`} - 

  * `target` {Node} - Returns the target element that this tooltip is anchored to. It is
either the element given by the `for` attribute, or the immediate parent
of the tooltip.

  * `manualMode` {`boolean`} - Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

  * `position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

  * `fitToVisibleBounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

  * `offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

  * `marginTop` {`number`} - This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

  * `animationEntry` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on entry.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animationExit` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on exit.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

  * `animationConfig` -

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
`for` {`string`} - The id of the element that the tooltip is anchored to. This element
must be a sibling of the tooltip. If this property is not set,
then the tooltip will be centered to the parent node containing it.

Property: for

attributes.name: animation-delay
attributes.description:
`animation-delay` {`number`} - The delay that will be applied before the `entry` animation is
played when showing the tooltip.

Property: animationDelay

attributes.name: manual-mode
attributes.description:
`manual-mode` {`boolean`} - Set this to true if you want to manually control when the tooltip
is shown or hidden.

Property: manualMode

Default: false

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
`position` {`string`} - Positions the tooltip to the top, right, bottom, left of its content.

Property: position

Default: bottom

attributes.name: fit-to-visible-bounds
attributes.description:
`fit-to-visible-bounds` {`boolean`} - If true, no parts of the tooltip will ever be shown offscreen.

Property: fitToVisibleBounds

Default: false

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description:
`offset` {`number`} - The spacing between the top of the tooltip and the element it is
anchored to.

Property: offset

Default: 14

attributes.name: margin-top
attributes.description:
`margin-top` {`number`} - This property is deprecated, but left over so that it doesn't
break exiting code. Please use `offset` instead. If both `offset` and
`marginTop` are provided, `marginTop` will be ignored.

Property: marginTop

Default: 14

attributes.name: animation-entry
attributes.description:
`animation-entry` {`string`} - The animation that will be played on entry.  This replaces the
deprecated animationConfig.  Entries here will override the
animationConfig settings.  You can enter your own animation
by setting it to the css class name.

Property: animationEntry

Default:

by setting it to the css class name.

Property: animationExit
